glsa.title: Adobe Acrobat Reader: Insecure temporary file creation
glsa.synopsis: An insecure temporary file creation vulnerability has been discovered in Adobe Acrobat Reader.

background.p: Acrobat Reader is a PDF reader released by Adobe.

description.p: SUSE reported that the "acroread" wrapper script does not create temporary files in a secure manner when handling SSL certificates (CVE-2008-0883).

impact.p: A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Adobe Acrobat Reader users should upgrade to the latest version:
